posts.post_content: Another neat planeswalker concept. He's good only when vast majority of your basic lands are mountains, and hes' vulnerable too. And that's just what mythics are ought to be: powerful but hard to play, not some average card. So this is one is fine mythic concept, IMO, unlike baneslayer, titans, jace 2.0 and other moneygrabbing autoincluded \*\*\*.

posts.post_content: His emblem is brutal. Even if you manage to protect yourself from it, via [Leyline of Sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Sanctity) once the emblem is out it becomes impossible to keep any guys on the board. Even Pro-Red doesn't work because neither the emblem itself, nor mountains (being basic lands) have a color.

posts.post_content:
A red Garruk who only works for mono red. Sweet holy mana acceleration!  
  
That being said, I wonder if anyone has tried putting him into Valakut Ramp? You could still get use out of those mountains after they trigger [Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle). Even better, with [Prismatic Omen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prismatic Omen) in extended, you could make your entire landbase into pingers without being mono-red.
posts.html:
A red Garruk who only works for mono red. Sweet holy mana acceleration!

That being said, I wonder if anyone has tried putting him into Valakut Ramp? You could still get use out of those mountains after they trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. Even better, with Prismatic Omen in extended, you could make your entire landbase into pingers without being mono-red.

Posted By: DacenOctavio (2/17/2011 6:49:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Very Straightforward abilities, especially the first one, consider you do untap an mountain, which means you can get an extra red mana in that turn, or you can use it as a 4/4 to dish out 4 damage.
  
   
Ultimately, he makes your mountains into pyromancers that can't be dealt damage by red or white/black removal. After all that been said, everyone here agrees the 'Fury' awesomeness he represent.
  
   
After reading the comcs, this guy is patient and resolute to execute his plans to destroy your opponents while Chandra on the other hand prefer to hit it head on.
  
   
Bet most of us here want to see Glissa from the next expansion, after all, she is a planeswalker. Too bad Slobad died in the last encounter.
posts.html:
Very Straightforward abilities, especially the first one, consider you do untap an mountain, which means you can get an extra red mana in that turn, or you can use it as a 4/4 to dish out 4 damage.

Ultimately, he makes your mountains into pyromancers that can't be dealt damage by red or white/black removal. After all that been said, everyone here agrees the 'Fury' awesomeness he represent.

After reading the comcs, this guy is patient and resolute to execute his plans to destroy your opponents while Chandra on the other hand prefer to hit it head on.

Bet most of us here want to see Glissa from the next expansion, after all, she is a planeswalker. Too bad Slobad died in the last encounter.

Posted By: SorianSadaskan (9/25/2010 8:45:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The thing I love most about Koth is his ability to drop turn-4 double-threats. Example: Koth, -2, [Chandra, the Firebrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, the Firebrand). Follow that up next turn with Chandra's -2 and a [Volt Charge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volt Charge) or [Tezzeret's Gambit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret's Gambit), so Koth's -2 can be used again! Koth encourages red players to think BIGGER, and I like that.
posts.html:
The thing I love most about Koth is his ability to drop turn-4 double-threats. Example: Koth, -2, Chandra, the Firebrand. Follow that up next turn with Chandra's -2 and a Volt Charge or Tezzeret's Gambit, so Koth's -2 can be used again! Koth encourages red players to think BIGGER, and I like that.

posts.post_content:
You could also, in principle, protect against his ultimate using [Pithing Needle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pithing Needle). Name "Mountain" and they'll still be able to tap for mana, but they won't be able to tap for damage.  
  
Of course, it'd be better, if you got it out in time, to just name Koth on the needle to begin with.
